author: Staff Reporter
text:
A special team of Child Line stopped two marriages scheduled to be held on Friday at Veerapandi and Nagalapuram in Bodi block on Thursday.

In the first incident, a couple had arranged the marriage of their 17-year-old daughter, studying Plus Two at Nagalapuram, with a 24-year-old earthmover driver from Perumalgoundenpatti village.

Acting on a tip-off, Child Line coordinators N. Chandra and N. Muneeswaran and police officials stopped the marriage after convincing their parents. They explained the ill-effects of child marriage to them and advised them to wait for the girl to attain 18 years of age to perform the marriage.

The Child Line coordinators also briefed the parents on the benefits and financial assistance the government is extending for legal marriage. Later, the parents stopped the marriage and assured to wait for one more year to perform the marriage of their daughter.

In the second incident, a couple in Veerapandi town had arranged the marriage of their 16-year-old girl with one Murugan (25) of the same area.

Child Line coordinator Vijayalakshmi, volunteer Kannan, Social Welfare Officer Chinna Mariammal and Gram Sevika Pasupathi tried to convince parents of the bride and the bridegroom to stop the marriage. But the parents refused to oblige and argued with the volunteers rudely.

The Child Line volunteers and the officials explained to the parents that the marriage was illegal and warned them of criminal action. Later, they rescued the girl and lodged her in a girls’ home run by an NGO at Koduvilarpatti.
title: Two child marriages stopped near Bodi
